sub_title: Lead Quality Monitoring at Rabobank W&R KYC Operations
summary:
Kamalini manages the Quality Monitoring team within the Rabobank Wholesale and Rural CDD organisation i.e., Global First Line Monitoring team that steers and coordinates the Wholesale and Rural FLM Community and aims to increase the FLM CDD maturity in the Wholesale and Rural domain and the Feedback Loop team that steers and maintains oversight into the quality of CDD files globally.

Prior to joining Rabobank, Kamalini started her professional career within Consulting at Ernst & Young (EY) in Forensic & Integrity Services. She was previously a Senior Manager at the EY South Africa and EY Netherlands practices and has 15 years of experience in Forensic investigations, Anti-fraud services, Anti-Money Laundering, and Anti bribery Anti-corruption compliance.
  
Kamalini has experience in conducting forensic investigations into disputes related to fraud, theft, corruption, bribery, assault and crimes of dishonesty. She also has experience in anti-fraud services, including fraud risk management, fraud and corruption risk assessments. Financial crime compliance specifically involving Anti Bribery & corruption, KYC, AML and Sanctions, as well as corruption due diligence required for mergers and acquisitions.
She has worked across the Financial services, Mining and metals, Oil and Gas, Transportation, Telecommunications, Retail and Consumer products and Manufacturing sectors.

Further to her consulting experience Kamalini has gained valued experience in leading outsourced Compliance and Ethics programs supporting various international clients in their Global Compliance and Ethics programs across their EMEA operations.

profile_positions.title: Manager Quality Monitoring CDD, W&R KYC Operations

profile_positions.description:
Senior Manager at the Ernst & Young Forensic & Integrity Services, Netherlands, Amsterdam practice. She was previously employed in the EY FIDS South Africa and has approximately 15 years of Work experience.  

She also has been involved in Anti Fraud Services, including fraud risk management, fraud and corruption risk assessments, Financial crime compliance specifically involving Anti Bribery & Corruption, KYC, AML and Sanctions.
She has had extensive experience working in South Africa and out of South Africa in Namibia, Tanzania , Mozambique, Swaziland, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Rwanda, Cameroon, Ghana and Liberia.

Her current role includes Corporate Compliance, Financial crime compliance, Integrity diligence and forensic investigations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager
Senior Manager: Fraud Investigations & Dispute Services

profile_positions.description:
Managing the Anti Bribery Anti Corruption (ABC) reporting process requirements for the Absa Group including Africa subsidiaries and Joint Ventures. 
Managing the policy requirements and processes related to ABC to mitigate any reputational risks.
Ensuring the development, distribution and regular review of training material and processes for Absa Group, Joint Ventures and Africa.
Providing leadership in the ABC realm to the specialist team within Group AML Compliance, to the business units, audit, legal, compliance, operations and other areas.
Setting the overall ABC strategy for Absa Group.
Responsible for reviewing and updating group-wide ABC policy and procedures, working closely with the immediate team members and stakeholders outside the team.
Assisting Group Money Laundering Control Officer in directing the functions affected by ABC requirements by developing the appropriate global ABC systems and controls, including close work with those responsible for gifts and entertainment, HR reward processes, finance, supplier and sourcing as well as business units to ensure Absa, its African subsidiaries and Joint Ventures remain on the cusp of the industry developments in this area.
Documenting of new trends and typologies related to Money Laundering to ensure growth and development of team members and promote the awareness with the Money Laundering Control representatives within the Group.
Maintaining control over the updating of information with regard to RCA, Key Principle Risks and Operational Risks (Key Risk Indicators KRI and Key Risk Scenarios-KRS to ensure reporting timelines are met. 
Providing day to day advice on ABC policy matters relating to customers and transactions.
Manage and/or execute all Adhoc requests related to Suspicious Transaction Reporting for Group and Internal projects and initiatives.
Monitoring, tracking and reporting on all investigated bribery and corruption related incidents that occur within the Group.
profile_positions.title: Group Manager Anti-Bribery Anti-Corruption

profile_positions.description:
Background:
Janice (Kamalini) has 7 years experience in general investigations.  Assisting investigation teams in terms of validation and verification of documentation, collation and testing the accuracy thereof, indexing and cross referencing source documents.  
She has experience in conducting investigations into disputes related to quantifying and verification of income fraud, theft, corruption, bribery, assault and crimes of dishonesty.  
She has been involved in strategic planning of investigations and is also experienced in managing assignments , and at times working totally independently through investigations.
She has had extensive experience with Procurement Fraud, Payroll Fraud in the Banking or Financial Services, Retail, Consumer Products & Entertainment,  Mining, Construction, Transport, as well as Technology /Telecommunications Industries. 

Skills:
Bachelor of Arts Degree (Psychology and Crminology)
Honours Degree (Forensic Criminology)

Experience:
She has worked in the Casino and Gaming industry, as a Surveillance Officer, and her primary role entailed the protection of all company operations and assets, internally and externally as well as developing and awareness of crime prevention, detection and observation and to ensure that company rules, and regulations and criminal statutory laws were enforced and adhered to.
This also involved compliance with FICA requirements.
Her currecnt responsibilities include general involvement in investigations .  Her experience includes involvement in investigations from planning, conducting interviews with suspects and witnesses, taking affidavits from suspects and witnesses, data analysis and report writing. She has also had experience with regards to testifying in court on criminal matters.  Janice has also had experience working out of South Africa in Namibia and Tanzania within the Forensic environment.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager (Forensics)

profile_positions.description:
The protection of all company operations and assets, internally and externally.
The keeping of high standards of efficiency and security in accordance with the policies and procedures of the company.
The gathering of information through the necessary channels and the report of the same to the managers.  
To ensure the procedures and compliance requirements of the Gauteng Gaming Act, rules and regulations are enforced and reported.
To develop an awareness of crime prevention, detection and observation and to ensure that company rules and regulations and criminal statutory laws are enforced and adhered to by all persons concerned. 
Ensuring compliance with FICA requirements.
On going training and development.
When applicable with the knowledge of managers, investigate all acts of alledged dishonesty, injury, breach of company’s code of conduct, loss, malicious damage to property, assault, all gaming related incidents and all other acts of complaints.
To record all incidents and to submit reports to the relevant HOD’s expeditiously.
To give evidence, in and making available of exhibits to criminal courts pertaining to investigations.
profile_positions.title: Surveillance Officer
